newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan ups fuel oil bunker price by $8 per tonne.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan ups fuel oil bunker price by $8 per tonne.

text.p: Taiwan's Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has raised prices of bunker fuel by a hefty $8 per tonne effective December 9, a company statement said on Monday.

Posted prices for 180-, 280- and 380-centistoke grade bunker fuel delivered at the ports of Keelung, Hualien, Taichung and Suao were increased by $8 per tonne, to $148. Term prices were also up by $8 to $145 per tonne.
Spot and term bunker C grade was also raised by $8, to $146 and $143 respectively.
CPC is Taiwan's sole supplier of bunker fuels.
